What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Diverse wet lab skills and public speaking/science communication
Participating in different labs allowed me to explore fields and topics that I would not have gotten the ability to explore otherwise.
Lots of lab experience and research connections

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Not really the "course" itself. but i feel that having the rotations together with "Methods and Logic" was overly taxing. The latter takes up two afternoon-evenings of a week and requires a large amount of time for out-of-class readings. From what I learned from my friends at MIT, their "Methods and Logic" course, which we adapted from, is meant to replace lab rotations in the first semester. Hence, I feel that Methods can be slimmed down to something like "Advanced Topics in Cell Biology" to allow more time for rotations.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
